diagrams.description: Organizational Behavior is the systematic study of how individuals, groups, and structures affect and are affected by behavior within organizations to improve effectiveness. It begins with individual analysis, examining personality, perception, motivation, and attitudes that drive employee actions. Group dynamics explores team formation, communication patterns, conflict resolution, and collaborative processes. Organizational structure analysis assesses hierarchies, culture, power distribution, and decision-making systems. Leadership investigation studies styles, influence mechanisms, and change management approaches. Performance outcomes measure productivity, satisfaction, and commitment. Intervention strategies implement training, development, and organizational redesign. The goal is to understand and optimize human behavior to enhance organizational performance, employee well-being, and adaptive
